page.title: 04FISH FARMING ON THE FIRTH
page.content: contwith their special food. Brian threw some food in by hand so that the fish would rise and we could see them more closely, and he explained how they buy them as very tiny fish and feed them until they grow to the size needed to sell them. We were able to see some fish at different stages. We learned, too, about some of the things that can go wrong; how fish can become ill and need medicine from the vet; how they get injections and how they have to be treated for lice. The cages are anchored by strong chain to huge concrete blocks in the sea and careful watch has to be kept to see that the chains are not wearing through with the constant movement of the water. Although the farm is out at sea, the fish are still liable to be attacked by cormorants which peck at cont.
